article.headline: Rider 89, Drexel 81 (OT)
article.story: LAWRENCEVILLE, N.J. (AP) -- Freshman Ryan Thompson scored six of his 16 points in overtime to lead Rider to an 89-81 win over Drexel on Monday night. The win was the fourth in a row for Rider (4-1). Drexel fell to 2-2. Trailing 75-67, Rider outscored Drexel 8-0 over the final 1:05 of regulation. Harris Mansell hit a 3-pointer with 56 seconds left to close the gap to five. Following a turnover, Jason Thompson, Ryan's older brother, hit two free throws. Drexel then missed a free throw, and Ryan Thompson's 3-pointer with 6 seconds left sent the game into overtime. Jason Thompson had 24 points and 11 rebounds for the Broncs and hit a career-high 14-of-17 free throws. Mansell (17), Joel Green (15) and Terrance Mouton (11) also scored in double figures for Rider. Drexel's Bashir Mason had a game-high 26 points to lead the Dragons, while Chaz Crawford and Frank Elegar added 13 apiece.

statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
